summary: The BMW N42 engine, produced from 2001 to 2004, is an inline-4 engine with a displacement of 1.8 L and 2.0 L options. It features a DOHC valvetrain with variable valve timing (VVT) and was notable for winning the 1.4-1.8 L category at the International Engine of the Year awards in 2001. The N42 was succeeded by the BMW N46 engine. A related engine, the smaller N40, also produced during this period, has a displacement of 1.6 L and lacks Valvetronic. Both engines are made of aluminum and use petrol as fuel.
